definition: to be stupid/to cheat or deceive/me or I (modest)
stupid/sluggish/clumsy/to wiggle (of worms)/to move in a disorderly fashion

sentences.english: She is an inveterate reader of silly love stories.
sentences.chinese: 她長年不變地讀愚蠢的愛情小說。

sentences.english: Julian came up with another of his hare-brained schemes for raising money.
sentences.chinese: 朱利安又提出了一個愚蠢的籌款計劃。

sentences.english: One thing to realize, I told you the id is outrageously stupid.
sentences.chinese: 一件要認識的事情，我告訴你本我是非常的愚蠢的。

sentences.english: That's a silliest idea I've ever heard.
sentences.chinese: 那是我聽到過的最愚蠢的想法。

sentences.english: I mean , he is the king of idiots.
sentences.chinese: 我的老闆真是愚蠢，我的意思是他是個大白癡。

sentences.english: To learn is a great virtue, but to be content with what one knows is stupid.
sentences.chinese: 學習是一個巨大的美德，但滿足於所知的就是愚蠢了。

sentences.english: A quick-tempered man does foolish things.
Look , I am very haleness! You are a enmity fetch among innumerability. Foolish and clumsiness are your epitaph.
sentences.chinese: 你是無數冤魂中的一個，愚蠢和笨拙是你的墓誌銘。

sentences.english: The foolish fox was frightened and fell in the forest.
sentences.chinese: 那隻愚蠢的狐狸受到驚嚇，躲在了樹林裏。
愚蠢的地精急切地點點頭。
鍊金術的理論並不愚蠢。

sentences.english: Don't take foolish liberties on the ski slopes.
sentences.chinese: 不要在滑雪坡道上作愚蠢地冒險。

sentences.english: The total inability to queue and just being generally gormless beyond belief.
sentences.chinese: 沒有排隊的習慣，而且是難以置信的愚蠢。

sentences.english: He doffed his stupid ideas and joined our side.
sentences.chinese: 他拋棄了他的愚蠢觀念並參加到我們方面來。
即使不愚蠢，也算不得聰明。

sentences.english: Mencken considered most Americans to be stupid and violent fools.
sentences.chinese: 門肯覺得大多數美國既愚蠢又粗野。

definition: to believe oneself infallible (idiom)/to be opinionated
